page.title: 04The Post Office at Norwell
page.content: Roger Barker took over the{Post {Office}in 1982 and set up a General Store on the same premises. He then added a milk round and a paper round. He also does relief milking. He works very long hours to earn his living and provide a service for the community. {A Typical Tuesday for Roger is... Get up 0300. Do milking at Norwell Woodhouse. Take cream to Southwell. Drive to Sneinton Market (Nottingham) to buy fresh fruit and vegetables. Back to the shop for 0500 to set up fruit and vegetables. Finish off milking. Drop newspapers off at Carlton, Cromwell, Bathley and South Muskham. Collect bread from Southwell and then deliver to South Muskham. Work in the shop until 1800. Collapse!
